events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle, requesting to open a new claim for evaluation.
The claim was categorised under the Auto Accident cluster for proper handling and risk assessment.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to act as the point of contact for the claimant and coordinate next steps.
Acknowledgment sent to the customer confirming receipt of the claim and prompt attention to their vehicle collision.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the driver's license to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including pictures of the vehicle damage and the official accident police report.
Investigation into the collision details and vehicle damages commenced according to the documentation provided.
Investigation completed with findings that confirm the extent of damage and liability for the vehicle collision.
A settlement offer was prepared and proposed to the customer, addressing repair costs and related expenses.
Customer responded positively, accepting the proposed settlement and expressing relief over the timely response.
Claim was approved based on investigation results and customer agreement to the settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the customer to cover repair costs as per the accepted settlement agreement.
The claim was officially closed following successful payment and confirmation that vehicle repairs would proceed.
All claim records were archived for future reference and compliance requirements after closure of the auto accident claim.
